error_analysis.summary: pip-audit failed because the '--strict' flag was used and it encountered an error. The package 'aifactory-os' (version 0.1.0) could not be found on the PyPI vulnerability database. This is expected behavior for local, private, or in-development packages that have not been published.
error_analysis.error_log_snippet: ERROR:pip_audit._cli:aifactory_os: Dependency not found on PyPI and could not be audited: aifactory-os (0.1.0)

resolution_options.description: Tell pip-audit to explicitly skip auditing the local package 'aifactory-os', as it is not expected to be on PyPI. This maintains strict checking for all other dependencies.
resolution_options.notes: This is the most precise solution. It keeps strict checking enabled but bypasses the lookup error for this specific package.

resolution_options.description: Remove the '--strict' flag. This will allow pip-audit to report the error as a warning (as seen in the log) but still exit with a 0 (success) code, allowing the process to continue.
resolution_options.notes: This is a broader solution. It will prevent this specific error from failing the build, but it will also allow other non-vulnerability errors (like network issues) to pass, which '--strict' would normally catch.

recommended_action: Implement 'solution_id: 1_ignore_local_package' to precisely skip the local package while maintaining strict auditing for all other dependencies.
